description: Identifier of the task or maintenance template this LEM line belongs to. Likely the maintenance task code; confirm with SME.
Schedule or occurrence number tying the line to a specific planned instance; used to group related LEM lines. Confirm with SME.
Line number within the LEM entry for ordering and reference.
Execution sequence of this item within the task or schedule.
Type of cost item (e.g., labor, equipment, materials, contractor).
Code or reference identifying the specific item, service, or vendor associated with this line.
Category/classification of the item or service for reporting and controls.
Free-text description of the item or service charged on this line.
Actual quantity of the item/service consumed or billed.
Unit of measure used for the quantity or billing basis.
Unit price applied to the item/service.
Extended line amount calculated from quantity and unit price.
Date the work, usage, or transaction occurred.
Warehouse or store from which the item was issued or managed.
Specific bin/location within the warehouse where the item is stored.
Inventory item or transaction type used for processing and reporting; confirm with SME.
Flag indicating whether the item is approved/valid in the item master; confirm with SME.
Indicates whether goods/service have been received or completed; confirm with SME.
General ledger account charged for this line.
Management unit or cost center responsible for the cost.
Code identifying the maintenance activity or work type performed.
Notes or comments providing context for the line item.
User-defined field for client-specific attributes (1).
User-defined field for client-specific attributes (2).
User-defined field for client-specific attributes (3).
User-defined field for client-specific attributes (4).
User-defined field for client-specific attributes (5).
User-defined field for client-specific attributes (6).
User-defined field for client-specific attributes (7).
User-defined field for client-specific attributes (8).
User-defined field for client-specific attributes (9).
User-defined flag or status indicator; usage varies by implementation. Confirm with SME.
Location/site code where the work or cost is associated.
Sub-location or area within the site tied to this line.
Identifier of the asset associated with the work or cost.
Flag indicating whether tax applies to this line.
Tax rate applied to the line amount.
Tax amount calculated for this line.
Hierarchy or indentation level used to group related lines; confirm with SME.
Actual location where the work was performed or item issued.
Labor craft or trade responsible for performing the work.
User ID that created the record.
Timestamp when the record was created.
User ID that last updated the record.
Timestamp of the most recent update.
Indicates whether this lineâ€™s cost is allocated across multiple assets or units.
Internal identifier linking to the vendor/supplier master record.
